'''Zebstrika''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ゼブライカ''' ''Zebraika'') is an {{type|Electric}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Blitzle}} starting at [[level]] 27.

==Biology==
Zebstrika is a zebra-like Pokémon. Its coat is black with white, jagged stripes all over its body. There is one pointed stripe extending from its nose, two elaborate stripes on its neck and chest, one zigzag stripe each on its jaws, back, and hindquarters, one triangular stripe on each of its thighs, and two stripes banding each of its legs. Its ears are triangular with blue insides, while its eyes are blue with yellow sclera and white eyelashes. Its nose is black, and its hooves are gray. A white, spiked mane runs the length of its body, beginning with two horn-like extensions on its forehead and running down its back to end in a long tail with a starburst-shaped tip. This irritable Pokémon fires lightning bolts from its mane when angry. Zebstrika can move as quickly as lightning, releasing thunderclaps at full gallop.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Elesa Zebstrika.png|thumb|250px|left|Zebstrika in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
Zebstrika debuted in ''[[BW039|Reunion Battles In Nimbasa!]]'', under the ownership of [[Stephan]]. It was revealed to have evolved from his Blitzle. In [[BW040|the next episode]], it was used in a battle against {{an|Bianca}} and her {{TP|Bianca|Minccino}}, in which it won. Later, during ''[[BW106|Strong Strategy Steals the Show!]]'', it battled {{Ash}} and his {{AP|Palpitoad}}, and the battle resulted in a tie.

A Zebstrika appeared in ''[[BW049|Enter Elesa, Electrifying Gym Leader!]]'', under the ownership of [[Elesa]]. It defeated Bianca's {{p|Shelmet}}, Minccino, and {{TP|Bianca|Pignite}}. Zebstrika reappeared in ''[[BW050|Dazzling the Nimbasa Gym!]]'', during Elesa's Gym battle against Ash; it battled Ash's Palpitoad and lost.

====Minor appearances====
Multiple Zebstrika appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M14|Black—Victini and Reshiram]]''.

A Zebstrika made a cameo appearance in ''[[BW067|Cilan Takes Flight!]]''.

A Zebstrika appeared in ''[[BW081|Crisis at Ferroseed Research!]]''.

A Zebstrika appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

A Zebstrika appeared in ''[[BW090|Jostling for the Junior Cup!]]'', under the ownership of [[Simeon]]. It was seen participating in the [[Pokémon World Tournament Junior Cup]].

Multiple Zebstrika appeared in ''[[BW102|Team Eevee and the Pokémon Rescue Squad!]]'', where they were in a ranch at [[Virgil]]'s house.

A Zebstrika appeared in a fantasy in ''[[XY009|Clemont's Got a Secret!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Elesa Zebstrika Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Zebstrika in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Be the Best! Pokémon B+W manga===
In ''[[PBW3|The Battle for More Friends!]]'', a {{tc|Pokémon Ranger}} used one with his {{p|Swanna}} in a [[Double Battle]] against [[Monta]]. Its {{a|Lightningrod}} [[Ability]] let it absorb the {{type|Electric}} attacks of Monta's {{p|Emolga}}. It was defeated by a {{a|Sand Force}}-boosted {{m|Dig}} from Monta's {{p|Excadrill}}.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
[[Elesa]] has a Zebstrika which was first seen in ''[[PS482|To Make a Musical]]'', where it was seen being dressed up in preparation of the Pokémon Musical. Later, it was used in a Gym Battle against {{adv|Black}}.

A Zebstrika appeared in ''[[PS494|Up in the Air]]''.

===In the Pokémon RéBURST manga===
[[Fraud]] has a Zebstrika in which he can use it as a [[Burst]] form.

==Trivia==
* Zebstrika shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Electivire}}. They are both known as the Thunderbolt Pokémon.
** It is one of a few Pokémon whose species name in English is the same as the name of a {{m|Thunderbolt|move}}.
* Zebstrika is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 497.

===Origin===
Zebstrika appears to be based on a {{wp|zebra}}. It may also be based on two of {{wp|Helios}}'s {{wp|Helios#Horses of Helios|steeds that pulled his chariot}}—Bronte and Sterope—which are Greek for thunder and lightning, respectively, as Zebstrika's species in Japanese can be translated as the "Thunder and Lightning Pokémon."

====Name origin====
Zebstrika may be a combination of ''{{wp|zebra}}'' and ''strike''. It may also be combined with a corruption of ''eléctrica'' (Spanish for feminine ''electric'').

Zebraika may be a combination of ''zebra'' and 雷火 ''raika'' (flash of lightning).
